shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction (fols. 3ra-17vb) - Mäqdǝmä wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 3ra-10va) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 10va-11va) - The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 11va-12rb) - Discourse "On the 72 Disciples" (fol. 12rb-va) - Canon tables (fols. 13r-16v) - On the reliability of the Gospels (fol. 17ra-va) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 17va-vb) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 17vb-63va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 17vb-18va) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 19ra-63va) - Postscript to the Gospel of Matthew (fol. 63va) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 64ra-92va) - Biography of Mark (fols. 64ra-va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 64va-65ra) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 66ra-92rb) - Postscript to the Gospel of Mark (fol. 92rb-va) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 92va-143rb) - Biography of Luke (fols. 92va-93ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fols. 93va-94rb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 96ra-143rb) - Postscript to the Gospel of Luke (fol. 143rb) V) Gospel of John (fols. 143va-182va) - Biography of John (fols. 143va-144rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 20 titles (fol. 144rb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 145ra-182rb) - Postscript to the Gospel of John (fol. 182va)
Additiones 1-6.

originlink.xlink:title: Mäḵodʿä Däbrä Gännät Kidanä Mǝḥrät / GKM

locationlink.xlink:title: Mäḵodʿä Däbrä Gännät Kidanä Mǝḥrät / GKM

donors.donor: Priest Wäldä Krǝstos (s. Additio 3, ls.1-2; also mentioned in Additiones 4 and 5). In the supplicating formulas following the titles of the Gospels the first part of his name has been erased and replaced with Maḫtämä (Maḫtämä Krǝstos).

txstates.txstate: Both boards are broken and repaired with a cord.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Traces of two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine (small holes).

squires.squire: A(2/s. l.: 1, 2, stubs after 2 (2)/fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – II(6/s. l.: 1, 2/fols. 13r-18v) – III(10/fols. 19r-28v) – IV(10/fols. 29r-38v) – V(10/fols. 39r-48v) – VI(10/fols. 49r-58v) – VII(7/s. l.: 1/fols. 59r-65v) – VIII(10/fols. 66r-75v) – IX(10/fols. 76r-85v) – X(10/fols. 86r-95v) – XI(10/fols. 96r-105v) – XII(10/fols. 106r-115v) – XIII(10/fols. 116r-125v) – XIV(10/fols. 126r-135v) – XV(9/s. l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 136r-144v) – XVI(10/fols. 145r-154v) – XVII(10/fols. 155r-164v) – XVIII(10/fols. 165r-174v) – XIX(9/s. l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 175r-183v)

taunit.mr-info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 20r).
taunit.cl-info: varying from 2 to 4 in the Canon tables
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 64r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 92r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the Canon tables and for the lists of tituli.

margin.info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 20r).

txcolumns.txcolumn: varying from 2 to 4 in the Canon tables

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 64r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 92r). Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the Canon tables and for the lists of tituli.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; chapter numbers and the word mǝˤǝraf; incipits of Gospel chapters and of minor texts (two initial lines); some of the marginal notes repeating chapter titles or indicating the liturgical occasions on which given sections should be read; name of the owner; parts of the Canon tables; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numerals in the text and in the margins. Incipits of Text I and of each of the four Gospels are written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 3r, 19r, 66r, 96r, 145r).

otherdetails.otherdetail: - For details concerning the traditional introduction texts s. R.W. COWLEY, “New Testament Introduction in the Andemta Commentary Tradition”, Ostkirchliche Studien 26, 1977, 144-92; R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart, 1989 (AeF 27), 6-36. - The titles of the Gospels and the following supplication formulas are written in two columns (not in one, as it is more usual). - The Ms. is the "Golden Gospel" of Mäḵodˤä gädam.

additional.cont: Fol. 2r: Note on the number of books in the monastic library followed by a hymn praising the Virgin Mary.
additional.det: 37 books were in the library of the monastery at the time when the note was written.

additional.tran: Fol. 182va: This Gospel (book belongs) to the chamber of sacred things. That they remember it in the time of prayer, I supplicate you; you say to the community of Däbrä Gännät, and its son Tärbinos, and its father Zä-Mäläkot, and its mother ˀArˀaya Ḫərit (?).

additional.cont: Fols. 182vb-183ra: Extensive note, for the most part erased.
additional.det: The greater part of the text (fol. 182vb) has been erased, although some letters are still visible. The legible paqssage contains the condemnation formula.

additional.cont: Fol. 183ra-rb: Donation note concerning land.
additional.det: Written in the main hand, the beginning is missing. About half of the text has been erased.

additional.cont: Fol. 183rb: Note on commomoration days of some individuals.
additional.det: Written in the main hand. The note lists the dates on which the deceased ʾAkalä Krǝstos, Wäldä Krǝstos, Giyorgis and Ṗawlos are commemorated.

additional.cont: Fol. 183v: Short note on the Gospels and Evangelists.
additional.det: Written in the main hand. The final part is unintelligible.

extras.extra: - Crude notes: fol. 1r. - Crude note in the upper margin: fol. 3r. - Numerous glosses or corrections written in a different hand, throughout the Ms.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - White threads are inserted in the upper corner of some folios. - Titles of the chapters are written in the upper margin.
